title: How Paint Finishes Change Color
description: A quick, practical guide to How Paint Finishes Change Color.

hook.text: Two cans of identical blue paint can look totally different on the wall. The secret isn't the pigmentâ€”it's the finish.

buildup.text: Matte finishes absorb light, making colors appear deeper and softer. They hide wall imperfections beautifully.

discovery.text: Gloss finishes reflect light, making the same color appear brighter and more saturated. They also show every bump.

twist.text: Eggshell sits between matte and glossâ€”a gentle sheen that's wipeable but forgiving. It dominates residential interiors.

climax.text: Designers often use flat paint on ceilings, eggshell on walls, and semi-gloss on trimâ€”three finishes, one room.

punchline.text: Same color, different finish, different room.

quiz.question: Why do matte paint finishes make colors appear deeper?
options: They absorb light instead of reflecting it
They contain more pigment per coat
They dry thicker than glossy paints
